brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the present study is to investigate different biomarkers like VEGF, EVGF
      and others ability to predict time to recidive and progressions free survival.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing of Different Biomarkers From Vena Rectalis Superior and Vena Cubiti in Patients Undergoing Low Anterior Resection for Rectum Cancer

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing LAR for rectum cancer is subjected. Preoperative blood samples from vena
      rectalis superior and vena cubiti is collected, as well as biopsies from tumor. Preoperative
      and after 3 month peripheral blood samples is collected.

      A total of 50 patients will be included in this study.

      The study is approved by the local scientific ethical committee No. S-20100006

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Histological verified cancer

          -  The cancer must be located in rectum maximum of 15 cm.

          -  Age above 18

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Disseminated cancer

          -  Perioperative radio-chemotherapy

          -  Laparoscopy surgery

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing open LAR for rectum cancer is subjected.

intervention.intervention_name: blood sampels from vena rectalis superior and vena cubiti

primary_outcome.measure: The primary aim of the present study is to investigate different biomarkers like VEGF, EVGF and others ability to predict time to recidive and progressions free survival.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
